text: What market condition is best confirmed by a rising price and rising Open Interest (OI)?
answers: Fake breakout (lack of commitment)
Long build-up (strong trend confirmation)
Short covering (trend weakening)
Long liquidation (panic selling)

text: In the context of Cumulative Volume Delta (CVD), what is absorption?
answers: Price makes a lower low while CVD makes a higher low, indicating passive buying absorbing selling pressure
Price makes a higher high and CVD also makes a higher high
Volume Delta bars are all positive and exceed the average daily range
Price moves sideways while CVD rises rapidly, signaling hidden accumulation

text: What does the TPO Value Area (TVA) represent?
answers: The range where only single prints occurred
The price range where price spent most of the session time (about 70%)
The price range where the highest volume was traded
The area between the session high and low

text: What is the TPO Point of Control (TPOC)?
answers: The midpoint of the session range
The price level with the highest traded volume
The price level where the session closed
The price level where the most time was spent during the session

text: A large sell limit order appears above price and disappears as price approaches it. What is this behavior called?
answers: Quote stuffing
Spoofing
Iceberg order
High Volume Node (HVN) creation

text: What is a Naked Point of Control (NPOC)?
answers: A newly formed POC in the current session
A prior sessionâ€™s POC that price has not revisited
A POC that already acted as support or resistance
A POC formed only during low-volume sessions

text: What is the key difference between TPO-based levels and Volume Profile levels?
answers: TPO focuses on time spent at price, not traded volume
Volume Profile ignores market structure
TPO uses volume while Volume Profile uses time
TPO only works on higher timeframes

text: How can Buy & Sell Volume help confirm an imbalance continuation or fade?
answers: By tracking how many indicators are on the chart
By identifying dominant buying or selling pressure within the candle
By measuring candle color only
By comparing volume to the daily high

text: How does Buy & Sell Volume help distinguish absorption from a true breakout?
answers: Absorption shows dominant volume without price continuation, while breakouts align volume with price movement
Absorption shows low volume while breakouts show high volume
Breakouts always occur at session highs or lows
Absorption occurs only during low-volatility sessions

text: What is the benefit of using combined SPOT & PERP aggregation?
answers: It highlights only retail trading activity
It removes derivatives noise entirely
It provides a more complete view of total market participation
It prioritizes spot volume over futures volume

text: Which market structure best defines a bullish trend?
answers: Equal highs and equal lows
Lower highs and lower lows
Higher highs and higher lows
Lower highs and higher lows

text: A trader has a $10,000 account and risks 1% per trade. With a 50-point stop and $1 per point value, what is the correct contract?
answers: 10 contracts
1 contract
2 contracts
5 contracts

text: Which RSI reading is most commonly considered overbought?
answers: RSI above 30
RSI above 70
RSI below 20
RSI between 40 and 50

text: What is a classic bullish signal in the MACD indicator?
answers: MACD line crossing above the signal line
Signal line flattening during consolidation
Histogram turning negative below zero
MACD crossing below signal above zero

text: Price is in an uptrend with higher highs and higher lows. Buy volume dominates at support, RSI holds above 50, and MACD crosses bullish  What does this indicate?
answers: A range-bound mean reversion trade
A bullish trend continuation with strong confluence
A high-risk countertrend reversal
A short setup due to exhaustion
